raw_html:
Norfloxacin: restricted use in urinary infections

Article date: December 2008

The European Medicines Agency (EMA) has concluded that the oral fluoroquinolone norfloxacin (Utinor) should not be used to treat acute or chronic complicated pyelonephritis. The Agency’s Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use concluded that this indication should be withdrawn because efficacy has not been adequately shown for this type of infection, and because the benefits of norfloxacin do not outweigh the potential risks in this indication.

Advice for healthcare professionals:

  • Oral norfloxacin should no longer be prescribed for newly diagnosed complicated pyelonephritis
  • Prescribers should review any patient taking oral norfloxacin for complicated pyelonephritis at their next scheduled visit, and should consider the need for alternative treatment if signs or symptoms of infection are persisting

See also:

EMA press release 


Article citation: Drug Safety Update Dec 2008, vol 2 issue 5: 7c.
